title: Installing XP from iso image by Tut 82 from rmprepusb.com

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
Hello,  
I'm trying to install XP from iso image on USB doing all instructions from tutorial 82 on rmprepusb.com .  
Everything is right only to first restart after copying i386 to hard disk. I'm testing on laptop which has not compatible/ide hdd option in bios so it works only on AHCI.  
After first restart I've got BSOD with code 07b - bootloader can't access to harddisk. I've tried to mount winvblock.ima.gz and add these drivers by F6 - after it installation goes a step ahead but it can't copy ahci drivers to harddisk and after restart there's another 07b BSOD.  
Can anybody help me how to manage it - I mean no integrating these drivers to iso image but adding them on start installation?   

**Edited by graffitikomp, 29 July 2012 - 11:36 AM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
You need to add a \[MassStorageDrivers\] and\[OEMBootFIles\] section to the answerfile with the correct drivers in one of the driver path folders. See  
[http://www.msfn.org/...post__p__543073](http://www.msfn.org/board/topic/80061-sata-drivers-and-ris/page__view__findpost__p__543073 "External link")  
The files could be placed in drvstorage if you had this path in your OEMPnPDriversPath setting and in the $OEM$ textmode folder too.  
See also [http://www.deployvis...18/Default.aspx](http://www.deployvista.com/Blog/tabid/70/EntryID/18/Default.aspx "External link")

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
I've added everything correct :  
drivers in IMDISK/COPYFOLDER/ahci/$OEM$/$1/TEXTMODE folder  
CF=ahci in menu.lst  

In answer file:  
OemPnpDriversPath = TEXTMODE  

\[MassStorageDrivers\]  
"Intel® 82801GR/GH SATA RAID Controller (Desktop ICH7R/DH)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 82801GR/GH SATA AHCI Controller (Desktop ICH7R/DH)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 82801GBM SATA AHCI Controller (Mobile ICH7M)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 82801FR SATA RAID Controller (Desktop ICH6R)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 82801FR SATA AHCI Controller (Desktop ICH6R)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 82801FBM SATA AHCI Controller (Mobile ICH6M)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 82801ER SATA RAID Controller (Desktop ICH5R)" = "OEM"  
"Intel® 6300ESB SATA RAID Controller" = "OEM"  

\[OEMBootFiles\]  
iaahci.cat  
iaahci.inf  
iastor.cat  
iastor.inf  
iastor.sys  
IMSM_PRE.inf  
txtsetup.oem  

But installer stops at first file iaahci.cat - it can't find it. Script runwinnt.cmd copies these files to T:I386$OEM$$1TEXTMODE - why it didn't change $OEM$ and $1 ?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Try putting files in $OEM$\\textmode as well as $oem$\\$1\\textmode  

> Selecting and Loading the Correct Mass-Storage Driver  
> If you are including new or updated drivers for mass-storage devices, you must add the new driver to **both** of these folders:  
>
> \\$OEM$\\Textmode  
> The location specified in the OemPnPDriversPath entry in the Unattend.txt file.  
> For example: \\$OEM$\\$1\\Pnpdrvrs\\storage

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: I've copied TEXTMODE from $OEM$/$1 to $OEM$ , there is no error after running winnt32 from runwinnt.cmd but after restart there's still 07b stop error.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Implies not correct driver. I might be quicker to test an XP install manually as in Tut #30. Do you know what the PCI ID is of the AHCI device?

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: It's ICH8M , I've tried tut 30, it works but I need alternative for low ram systems. Tut 30 needs to load whole iso to ram.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Don't see ICH8M in your answer file??  
Does the PCI ID appear in the txtsetup.oem file?  
If not - you have the the wrong AHCI drivers (looks like an old one) - try the one in the Tut 30 download  
add  
"Intel(R ) ICH8M-E/M SATA AHCI Controller"="OEM"  

(check it matches *exactly* the text in the \[scsi\] section of txtsetup.oem)  
to the list in the Mass Storage Drivers section - there should be no space after (R and before the ) but this forum mucks up text like ( R ) and changes it to ® and also changes t to TAB!  

or use an F6 AHCI driver downloaded from the Intel site.

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: My fault, I have had not correct answer file. Now it works. Thanks for your patience. And help of course.

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
Now I've got problem with xp installation with tut 30. The same laptop, ICH8M AHCI controller, WIndows loads drivers correctly by F6, then installation continues.  
Step 2 starts from pendrive correctly, then continues in graphical mode: I put key, regional setting etc. Installation goes to the end and reboots computer.  
After reboot I got 07b stop error. What to do?   

**Edited by graffitikomp, 30 July 2012 - 07:50 PM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
Not seen that before! Did you use both WinVBlock and Firadisk? Did you get the 'unsigned driver' prompts?  
Try Tut 82 too?

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
I tried Firadisk + ICH8M, didn't try WinVBlock + ICH8. I got unsigned driver prompts and accept them.  
I told you before, tut82 works for me perfectly.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: If tut 82 works (not sure if you posted before it had fully completed), then must be a firadisk issue - try both firadisk and winvblock next time!

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: You mean firadisk+winvblock+ich8 or only in pairs: firadisk+ich8(tested and unsuccessful) or winvblock+ich8?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: all 3 at same time or winvblock+ich8M - usually I just use all 3 (f+w+driver) if I want the best chance of it working!

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: I've loaded all 3 at same time. No success. 07b after restart.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: what is the PCI ID of the AHCI device? Is it in your INF files? Check log files setupact and setupapi... XP creates the following log files: * setupact.log-This log file contains a list of actions in chronological order that occurred during the graphical installation phase, such as file copies and registry changes. The OS also stores setup error log entries in this file. XP writes the setupact.log file to the %systemroot% folder (e.g., c:windows). * setuperr.log-This log file contains a list of errors that occurred during installation and their severity (this log file should be 0 bytes in size if no errors occurred during installation). XP writes the setuperr.log file to the %systemroot% folder. * comsetup.log-This log file contains installation information about Optional Component Manager and COM+ components. XP writes the comsetup.log file to the %systemroot% folder. * setupapi.log-XP writes information to the setupapi.log file each time a .inf file executes, including any errors. XP writes the setupapi.log file to the %systemroot% folder. * netsetup.log-This log file contains information about workgroup and domain membership. XP writes the netsetup.log file to the %systemroot%debug folder. * setup.log-The Recovery Console (RC) uses the setup.log file to gain information about the Windows installation during repair operations. XP writes the setup.log file to the %systemroot%repair folder.

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
It's ICH8M, installer loads textmode drivers correctly, otherwise it can't see hdd. I mean installing with tutorial 30 - it's only iso file and winvblock image loaded before, no answer file so I don't need to set any path to drivers.  

In setupact.log there's an info about finishing installation in graphical mode, setuperr.log is empty, comsetup.log says that's setup finished, there's no error in setupapi.log, netsetup.log and setup.log.   

**Edited by graffitikomp, 31 July 2012 - 09:04 AM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: of course! Not had my coffee yet (just got up!)! I am not sure what is going on - try checking log files. If 82 works then manual method 30 should...

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
It looks like installer loads drivers in textmode but doesn't copy them to windows and can't start from hdd. My question is why.  
I tired to search all log files and find any ICH8 string there. No success. There's no any.   

**Edited by graffitikomp, 31 July 2012 - 09:09 AM.**

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Are they signed and with cat files - any clues in log files?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Third time of asking - **what is the PCI ID** of the AHCI device (hint the answer should start with 8086!) and is the same PCI ID in the txtsetup.oem file against ICH8M?

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content:
I've got PCI ID 2829 = "Intel® ICH8M-E/M SATA AHCI Controller".  
In setup.log I've found that:  
WINDOWSOemDiroemscs03.inf = "iaAHCI.inf","8c72","","Intel® Rapid Storage Technology Driver","iaStor.sys"  
WINDOWSsystem32driversiaStor.sys = "iaStor.sys","7a09c","","Intel® Rapid Storage Technology Driver","iaStor.sys"  
WINDOWSOemDiroemscs02.inf = "WinVBlk.Inf","c080","","WinVBlock Driver Disk","WinVBlk.inf"  
WINDOWSsystem32driversWVBlk32.Sys = "WVBlk32.Sys","f368","","WinVBlock Driver Disk","WinVBlk.inf"  
WINDOWSOemDiroemscs01.inf = "firadisk.inf","db1f","","FiraDisk Installation Disk","firadisk.inf"  
WINDOWSsystem32driversfiradisk.sys = "firadisk.sys","cf69","","FiraDisk Installation Disk","firadisk.inf"

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: So what should I do to make it work?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
How do you know it is 8086 2829 - did you run PCIID.ima.gz from Tutorial 30?  
If so, and the drivers and INF file are correct - then I don't know.

XP writes the setupact.log file to the %systemroot% folder (e.g., c:windows). * setuperr.log-This log file contains a list of errors that occurred during installation and their severity (this log file should be 0 bytes in size if no errors occurred during installation). forumNotes.author: graffitikomp

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Well, not quite - what files did you replace (just the INF, SYS, CAT etc and not the txtsetup.oem???). It implies there is a problem in my download??? Can you attach your folder contents so I can test and compare?

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: Heh, I've replaced txtsetup.oem too and added winvblock \& firadisk lines to the new txtsetup.oem. Simply replacing txtsetup.oem is causing that there's no firadisk \& winvblock drivers in textmode after F6.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: You didn't use [winvblockJmicron_C600.ima.gz.gz](https://sites.google.com/a/rmprepusb.com/www/tutorials/install-xp-from-an-iso/winvblockJmicron_C600.ima.gz.gz?attredirects=0 "External link") did you? That is only for jmicron or C600 systems - it won't work for other Intel chipsets.

forumNotes.author: graffitikomp
forumNotes.content: No, I did use winvblock.ima.gz - it works partially, installer can load the drivers but doesn't install them to Windows so there's an error after restart.
